Tucson thought for a moment,and then, he could sense something, the signatu=
re of a very familliar friend.  

" I think I know how we can do that Kup..=
  As it turns out, we're not alone..  I - just picked up another Autobot si=
gnature... It's Night Shift, he made it... He actually made it out of that =
last skirmish unharmed..  According to the transmission I'm getting, he's a=
t the old Maximal base.  Night Shift is specially trained in Special Ops mi=
ssion work.  When in doubt send in a specialist.  Prowl and Mirage trained =
him personally, and with your guidence and his help, I think we have a good=
 chance at doing things without being discovered. Night Shift also knows ho=
w to pretend.  One time, he actually cloaked his Autobot symbol and made it=
 appear Decepticon so he could sneak around Megatron without being suspecte=
d of double crossing.....  Wait a minute...  Kup, what if he did that for u=
s again?  What if he went in as a pretender, cloaked the Decepticon faction=
 symbol and his signature to match theirs, could he actually pull off a res=
cue right under their noses?"



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@=
...> wrote:
>
> Kup:
> 
> "We will get them back My friend"Said camly the m=
ale"We must to plan it well in order to dont have another mia"
>

com 
> Subject: Re: Back to the Ark

> 
>   
> Before he could answer Kup=
, Tucson listens to the voice of the Matrix,Kup and to Lord Elder. Once aga=
in they had caught him just in time to pull him from what could have been a=
n emotional disaster. He was thankful for that.
> 
> " I guess I don't know=
 the difference between being too self absorbed and when it's all right to =
actually state how valuable one self is to a cause. I have to stop doubting=
 myself as far as worth is concerned. I'll kick myself in the aft to improv=
e if I have to." 
> 
> He then thinks about his disability and pauses for j=
ust a moment.
> 
> " Well, now that I need to kind of change gears for a mo=
ment, I suppose I should see myself as an innovator, who's self worth is ra=
ther valuable to the cause of turning things around for everyone and not ju=
st for himself. I'm not saying I'm a God, and that to me would be far too f=
etched. But now, if I were to rate my self worth, I'd say my role as an Aut=
obot is valuable. If I had not persisted in trying to find out what happene=
d to Rodimus, not only would I not have found him, I would not have been ab=
le to stop the same thing from happening to others. And now that I do reali=
ze what's going on, and the fact that I could have nearly fallen down the s=
ame path, which I hope never to do, thanks to all of you, and the voice I k=
eep hearing, I can finally do some real good around here. And I promise, I'=
ll work with each and every one of you, to the best of my abilities,
> and =
try to come up with new ways upon which to do so."
> 
> Another pause.
> 
>=
 " Now that I've woken up a bit, I suppose I'd like to be able to see again=
, I just haven't really gotten around to asking someone on how to repair my=
 visual circuitry... Heh, truth is, I'm one of the biggest procrastinators =
on Cybertron. I guess I've just been putting it off too long, after getting=
 used to not having my sight, it just became second nature to me. And in so=
me respects, perhaps I did not want to actually "See" the truth of the situ=
ation. And of course, major confession coming out here... At the time, Ratc=
het was doing repairs and well I didn't want to burden him with anything...=
 He had enough going on. After a while I completely forgot and then another=
 major war happened and before I knew it I lost track of time.. But now the=
re is time for the repair. I just need to have my circuitry examined before=
 it is repaired... I don't know the extend of my damages truthfully.."
> 
>=
 He sighs.
> 
> "I'm not good at tolerating bad news, you probably already =
know that."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclo=
nus@> wrote:
> >
> > > > What am I worth? How can I be worth something when=
 there are lives just starting out there that are more precious than my own=
? And how can I say I'm worth something when we have young aspiring Autobot=
s and Maximals just starting their careers as soldiers? They have their who=
le lives ahead of them, and by Primus I'm prepared to give back what's been=
 taken from them, THEIR FREEDOM!"
> > 
> > "All sentient being have worth y=
oung Tuscon." comes that whisper again
> > as Tuscon positioned himself nea=
r to the body of Optimus. "If you do
> > not count your self as worth anyth=
ing how can any one else see you as
> > worthy of anything?"
> > 
> > Even =
as the voice spoke to Tuscon, Lord Elder chimed in, unknowingly
> > agreein=
g with the whispered voice, "You know, you sound like Rodimus.
> > He used =
to say things like that. He would get depressed when he
> > failed. Even if=
 he won the battle, he would sometimes find things that
> > he missed."
> >=
 
> > "Yes Tuscon" the whispered voice continued. "Do not tie your sense of=

> > self to your successes, but to your efforts to achieve that success.
>=
 > Who you are defines your value, not what you have you have achieved."
> =
>

> > =
Optimus, "Tell me something Tuscon, we are not biological creatures
> > but=
 technological, yet you are blind, why have you chosen to remain
> > so? co=
uld it be because you choose to remember the pain of loss or
> > failure?"
=
> >

> > Optimus himself, "Do not make the mistake that Rodimus has made. He
> =
> lost the energy matrix and himself in that loss. He will need your
> > he=
lp to remember his own value. Only then can the power of the matrix
> > hel=
p him. But first *you* must see his value, and your own."
